messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/11/2003 7:33:26 PM Central Standard Time,
bluelotus@... writes:


> There is a brand of diapers that is totally natural and biodegradable, made
> out of corn

Thanks for the info. But Nathan also has a corn allergy, so I'm not so sure.
I'll check out the site.

Elizabeth


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom]pull ups/diapers, was jeans and sensitivities
messages.messageBody:
<< On a side note to this, my son (4 1/2) is not potty trained over night. We
put him in good nites pull ups but he soaks them. Sometimes he gets up,
sometimes he doesn't. He has horrible itchiness and some rashes from the
wetness, or maybe from the chemicals in the pull up. Any suggestions of
natural overnight protection? Brands or cotton diaper type pullups to buy
and where to get them? I'd like to try something for the poor kid. >>

There is a brand of diapers that is totally natural and biodegradable, made out of corn. They're called Nature Boy & Girl. You can find them at health food stores but sometimes at other stores too, or order them from drugstore.com. That's what we've used since we switched to disposable diapers. I've heard people complain about regular diapers because of rashes and allergic reactions. These diapers are totally friendly to the body and the environment.

here's their web site: http://www.norseanatural.com/

Yol
